Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2008 10:22PM dawn2203 wrote: My mum was diagnosed with cancer in both her breasts 7 years ago, she underwent bilateral masectomy and then did tamoxifen for 5 years no other treatment was offered to her. Today she is still cancer free and her health is excellent. best wishes to your sister in law my prayers are with you all.
Posts.Title: Cancer in both breasts petesmom AnneW

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2008 08:35PM dawn2203 wrote: Hi Christie, know exactly how you feel. It broke my heart when my hair started falling out. When I was diagnosed my hair was long, when the onc said I had to have chemo I had it cut to my shoulders to try and make the impact less traumatic. When most of my hair had fallen out I got my dh to shave the remains off. Although its not the same has having your own hair I had quite alot of fun wearing different wigs, various colours and styles. Cancer sucks and chemo was horrible but with the treatment it gives us a fighting chance. Good luck. Dawn.x
